project.name: damage-pipeline
project.description: This plugin processes damage through a node network, allowing for advanced damage processing effects.

Plugins.name: Plugins
Plugins.description: Damage Pipeline encompasses methods to perform advanced damage processing.

Pack.name: Pack
Pack.description: Damage Pack, a message containing information about incoming damage.

PipelineNode.name: PipelineNode

MeterNode.name: MeterNode
MeterNode.description:
Meter Node, a pipeline object that extends the standard Pipeline Node with a meter.

The Meter Node has several built-in functions. Each receives a Pack as its argument. You can override these to perform custom functionality.
  • doOnReceive: called when the node receives a Pack. Default behaviour: Apply Pack to meter
  • doOnZero: called when the node drops to 0. Default behaviour: None
  • doOnMax: called when the node rises to maximum. Default behaviour: None
  • doOnBreak: called when the node drops below 0. Default behaviour: None
  • doOnOverflow: called when the node rises above maximum. Default behaviour: None


The Pipeline Node inherits all functionality of the Pipeline Node, but it implements a custom version of the _operation method. You should override the above functions instead. As an extension of PipelineNode, the MeterNode will automatically process all packs and subpacks in bottom-up order. You do not need to write methods to deal with subpacks.

Kiwi.Plugins.DamagePipeline.name: Kiwi.Plugins.DamagePipeline
Kiwi.Plugins.DamagePipeline.description: Damage Pipeline encompasses methods to perform advanced damage processing.

Kiwi.Plugins.DamagePipeline.Pack.name: Kiwi.Plugins.DamagePipeline.Pack
Kiwi.Plugins.DamagePipeline.Pack.description: Damage Pack, a message containing information about incoming damage.

props.name: mode
props.description:
Operational mode: one of
	Kiwi.Plugins.DamagePipeline.Pack.prototype.SUBTRACT (default),
	Kiwi.Plugins.DamagePipeline.Pack.prototype.ADD, or
	Kiwi.Plugins.DamagePipeline.Pack.prototype.SET.
	You may also use string shortcuts "ADD", "SET", and "SUBTRACT".

props.name: tags
props.description:
List of tags for this pack,
	as strings or numbers.

Kiwi.Plugins.DamagePipeline.PipelineNode.name: Kiwi.Plugins.DamagePipeline.PipelineNode

props.name: children
props.description: Array of child nodes, or a single node

props.name: operation
props.description: Function to run on received Packs

props.name: tags
props.description: Array of tags, or a single tag

Kiwi.Plugins.DamagePipeline.MeterNode.name: Kiwi.Plugins.DamagePipeline.MeterNode
Kiwi.Plugins.DamagePipeline.MeterNode.description:
Meter Node, a pipeline object that extends the standard Pipeline Node with a meter.

The Meter Node has several built-in functions. Each receives a Pack as its argument. You can override these to perform custom functionality.
  • doOnReceive: called when the node receives a Pack. Default behaviour: Apply Pack to meter
  • doOnZero: called when the node drops to 0. Default behaviour: None
  • doOnMax: called when the node rises to maximum. Default behaviour: None
  • doOnBreak: called when the node drops below 0. Default behaviour: None
  • doOnOverflow: called when the node rises above maximum. Default behaviour: None


The Pipeline Node inherits all functionality of the Pipeline Node, but it implements a custom version of the _operation method. You should override the above functions instead. As an extension of PipelineNode, the MeterNode will automatically process all packs and subpacks in bottom-up order. You do not need to write methods to deal with subpacks.

props.name: children
props.description: Array of child nodes, or a single node

props.name: tags
props.description: Array of tags, or a single tag

classitems.description: The name of this plugin.
classitems.name: name

classitems.description: The version of this plugin.
classitems.name: version

classitems.description: Minimum version of Kiwi.js library
classitems.name: minimumKiwiVersion

classitems.description: Registers this plugin with the Global Kiwi Plugins Manager if it is available.

This create method is executed when Kiwi Game that has been told
to use this plugin reaches the boot stage of the game loop.
classitems.name: create

params.name: game
params.description: The game that is current in the boot stage.

classitems.description:
An exhausted Pack will have no further effect.
	The tree may terminate its traversal.
classitems.name: exhausted

classitems.description: Private value of this Pack.
classitems.name: _value

classitems.description: Sub-packs for this Pack, representing subordinate damage sources.
classitems.name: subPacks

classitems.description: Damage mode: add to meters.
classitems.name: ADD

classitems.description: Damage mode: set meters to constant value.
classitems.name: SET

classitems.description: Damage mode: subtract from meters.
classitems.name: SUBTRACT

classitems.description:
Value of this Pack. If it falls to or below 0, it is exhausted.

When you modify value, it will automatically check and discard any exhausted subPacks. This is designed for a pipeline in which subPacks are evaluated before the parent pack.
classitems.name: value

classitems.description: Checks for exhaustion on this and all subPacks
classitems.name: checkExhaustion

return.description: The current exhaustion state of this pack

classitems.description: Clones this Pack, along with all subpacks
classitems.name: clone

classitems.description:
Removes all subPacks that are now exhausted. You do not normally need to call
	this method; it will automatically occur while modifying values.
classitems.name: discardExhaustedSubPacks

classitems.description:
Extracts and returns a subPack from this Pack or subpacks.
	Some damage pipeline nodes may split packs onto different branches.
	If the subPack is not found, this returns null.
classitems.name: extractSubPack

classitems.description:
Returns a list of all subPacks and this Pack.
	These will be in reverse order to a normal traversal, so this pack
	will be last in the list. This facilitates pipeline processing.
classitems.name: getAllPacks

classitems.description: Returns whether this pack has the specified tag.
classitems.name: hasTag

params.name: tag
params.description: Tag to check; may also be of type Number

classitems.description:
Returns whether this pack has any tag from the specified array.
	An empty array is always true.
classitems.name: hasTagInArray

params.name: array
params.description: Array of tags, either String or Number

classitems.description: Returns the type of object that this is.
classitems.name: objType

classitems.description: Parses the param object and sanitizes inputs.
classitems.name: parseParams

params.name: params
params.description: The param object from the constructor.

classitems.description: Mode of this Pack, either ADD, SUBTRACT or SET.
classitems.name: mode

classitems.description: Owner of this Pack. If the owner was not set, it returns null.
classitems.name: owner

classitems.description:
Tags for this Pack, representing special information
	about damage types such as "fire" or "stun".
classitems.name: tags

classitems.description:
Adds a child. The child must be a pipeline node, and cannot share a name
	with other children.
classitems.name: addChild

classitems.description: Adds a tag. The tag must be a String or Number, and cannot be a duplicate.
classitems.name: addTag

params.name: tag
params.description: Tag; can be either String or Number

classitems.description: Removes all children from this node.
classitems.name: clearChildren

classitems.description: Removes all tags from this node.
classitems.name: clearTags

classitems.description:
Attempts to send a pack to another node.
	Always removes the pack from this node.
	Deals with situations where the node does not exist,
	or the pack is exhausted.
	Call this from the "_operate()" function.
classitems.name: dispatch

classitems.description:
Attempts to send a pack to the default child node.
	This is defined by "this.defaultChildIndex" and is normally index 0.
	Always removes the pack from this node.
	Deals with situations where the node does not exist,
	or the pack is exhausted.
	All packs are sent to default unless "doDefaultDispatch" is
	set to "false".
classitems.name: dispatchDefault

classitems.description: Extracts and returns a pack from any parents
classitems.name: extractPack

classitems.description:
Returns the child with this name, or null if it does not exist.
	Searches only direct children.
classitems.name: getChildByName

classitems.description: Returns whether this node has the specified tag.
classitems.name: hasTag

params.name: tag
params.description: Tag; can be either String or Number

classitems.description: Returns the type of object that this is.
classitems.name: objType

classitems.description:
Core method. Override with your own functions that process and/or
	dispatch the "pack" parameter.
classitems.name: _operate

classitems.description: Parses the params object, sets internal properties, and sanitizes input.
classitems.name: _parseParams

classitems.description: Child nodes of this PipelineNode to which it may pass Packs
classitems.name: _children

classitems.description: The master pack which will next be dispatched.
classitems.name: _currentMasterPack

classitems.description:
Index of the default child, to which Packs that do not match
	any tags or are otherwise treated as defaults are sent.
classitems.name: defaultChildIndex

classitems.description:
Whether to send packs to the default dispatch automatically after
	running operations
classitems.name: doDefaultDispatch

classitems.description:
The name of this node. This is used by the node's parents to select it,
	so it should be at least locally unique.
classitems.name: name

classitems.description:
Signal dispatched on pack dispatch
	with parameters "this", "pack"
classitems.name: onDispatch

classitems.description:
Signal dispatched on pack exhaustion
	with parameters "this", "pack"
classitems.name: onExhaust

classitems.description:
List of Packs which the node has received and is currently processing.
	Please use the "receive( pack )" method to add packs
	from other sources.
classitems.name: _packs

classitems.description:
Whether the node will run "process()" immediately upon receiving
	a Pack. If false, you will have to manually run "process()".
classitems.name: processOnReceive

classitems.description:
Whether to process a pack top-down; that is, the master pack
	followed by its children. This is DISABLED by default.
	If a top-level pack is emptied, its children will be discarded
	before they can be processed. For this reason we normally
	process bottom-up, doing the children first then their parent.
	However, in some cases it may be useful to extract the topmost
	case of a tag, not the bottommost, so this flag is provided.
classitems.name: processTopDown

classitems.description:
List of tags on this node.
	The node will pass any Packs that don't share any tags
	on to the child defined by "defaultChildIndex"
	without running "_operate()" on those Packs.
	All matching Packs will incur operation.
classitems.name: _tags

classitems.description:
Performs the node operation on all current packs. The operation is only performed on those packs which match a tag of this node. If this node has no tags, all nodes are processed. All nodes are subsequently sent to dispatchDefault unless doDefaultDispatch has been set to false.

The process goes through each pack bottom-up; the deepest children are evaluated first, working up to the root pack.

If you want to evaluate top-down, set processTopDown to true. Be careful when evaulating top-down, as you may cause packs to be discarded with a parent before they are processed.

This is normally called directly after damage is received. However, if you have not set the processOnReceive flag, it will not execute immediately. You can call it according to your own requirements.
classitems.name: process

classitems.description: Receives a damage pack
classitems.name: receive

classitems.description: Removes a child, if it is currently a child.
classitems.name: removeChild

classitems.description: Removes a tag, if it is currently a tag.
classitems.name: removeTag

params.name: tag
params.description: Tag; can be either String or Number

classitems.description:
Signal dispatched on meter break
	with parameter "this"
classitems.name: onBreak

classitems.description:
Signal dispatched on meter max
	with parameter "this"
classitems.name: onMax

classitems.description:
Signal dispatched on meter overflow
	with parameter "this"
classitems.name: onOverflow

classitems.description:
Signal dispatched when the meter processes a pack
	with parameter "this"
classitems.name: onReceive

classitems.description:
Signal dispatched on meter zero
	with parameter "this"
classitems.name: onZero

classitems.description: Normalized value is equal to value divided by valueMax.
classitems.name: valueNormalized

classitems.description: Parses the params object and sanitizes input
classitems.name: _parseParams

classitems.description: Maximum value of the meter
classitems.name: valueMax

classitems.description: Value of the meter
classitems.name: value

classitems.description: Value of the meter before the current Pack operation
classitems.name: valueLast

classitems.description:
Empty method called on meter break, when the meter would go negative
	(that is, the meter is empty, the Pack still
	has value left, and the Pack is set to SUBTRACT mode).
	Override this with your custom functionality.
classitems.name: doOnBreak

classitems.description:
Empty method called on meter max, when the meter rises to maximum.
	Max does not occur if the meter was already at maximum.
	Override this with your custom functionality.
classitems.name: doOnMax

classitems.description:
Empty method called on meter overflow, when the meter would overflow
	(that is, the meter is at max, the Pack still has value left, and
	the Pack is set to ADD mode).
	Override this with your custom functionality.
classitems.name: doOnOverflow

classitems.description:
Default method executed upon receiving a Pack. This will transfer value from the Pack to the meter's value, according to the pack mode (ADD, SUBTRACT, or SET). If there is any value left over, it will remain in the Pack. It is not recommended that you override this function.

When receiving a Pack with mode SET, this function will assign as much value to this meter as it can fit. Any leftover value will remain in the Pack. This is intended to trigger overflow behaviour. It might create unexpected results if the pack is not discarded.
classitems.name: doOnReceive

classitems.description:
Empty method called on meter zero, when the meter drops to zero.
	Zero does not occur if the meter was already at zero.
	Override this with your custom functionality.
classitems.name: doOnZero

classitems.description: Core method that dispatches user-defined functions. Do not override.
classitems.name: _operate
